using_illustrations.overview: The best way to insert illustrations into your Paratext project is to insert the sample illustrations as placeholders, as you can search for appropriate illustrations using keywords, directly from Paratext's Insert Figure dialog.

download_and_unzip.title: Download and Unzip Image Files and Folders
instructions: Visit the SIL Illustration Samples folder
Either browse within the appropriate language folder for the sets of images you want, and download those OR download all images by right-clicking on the language folder and selecting Download
Note that these are low-resolution watermarked images
Unzip this collection to a folder within your Pictures folder to ensure images are included in Windows' search index
If storing elsewhere, add that folder to Windows' search indexing
download_and_unzip.troubleshooting: On some systems, the Windows Search Index might not return results for key terms. Workarounds: 1) Open File Explorer > Options > Search tab > Check 'Always search file names and contents', or 2) Prefix search terms with 'tags:' (e.g., 'tags:sheep AND tags:LUK02')

find_and_insert.title: Find and Insert Images in Paratext
steps: In Paratext, position the cursor in the passage where you want to insert a picture
Go to Project menu > Insert > Figure...
Click the Browse button
Navigate to the folder where you unzipped your collection
Click in the SEARCH box in the top right corner
Enter one or more terms to search for

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.subtitle: About our Maps, and Why You Need a Labeler

content.overview: The SIL Map Repository is a collection of maps and diagrams that may be helpful in Scripture publications. Most of the maps currently contained in the repository are owned by SIL Global, with attribution rules that credit Wycliffe Bible Translators, Inc., and where applicable, the artists.
content.supplementary_collection: There is also a supplementary collection of 3 maps/diagrams based on artwork by Horace Knowles, owned by the British and Foreign Bible Societies. Our current licensing agreement only allows us to distribute these for use on SIL-supported projects.
content.data_merge: All of our maps and diagrams are enabled for use with data merge files. These data merge files should contain the map labels configured from your Paratext project data. While it is possible to copy and paste label text into any of our map files, this is strongly discouraged.
content.place_names_issue: Place-names are notorious for being spelled inconsistently in minority language Scripture projects, because they are typically transliterations, and there are always multiple ways that Hebrew or Greek terms could be transliterated into any given language.
content.solution: The solution is to use either the Scripture Map Labeler plugin for Paratext (https://sites.google.com/sil.org/scripture-map-labeler/home), or its successor, the Paratext Diagram Labeler (tiny.cc/labeler). Both can generate data merge files for Adobe InDesign (IDML maps) and for Map Creator (MAPX maps).
content.indesign_note: If you will be using other writing systems, other digit systems, or just other fonts, be sure to read the instructions on the best way to set this up.
content.map_creator: Several (but not yet all) of our IDML maps are also available in MAPX format. In addition, a custom version of the Bible maps that are built into Map Creator are available in this map repository. Use these copies rather than the built-in templates with Paratext Diagram Labeler.

samples.title: Samples
samples.description: Samples of all maps are available. Translation teams will generally only need to download this folder of samples. This is the same folder included within the SIL Map Repository folder as !All Map Samples.
samples.typesetter_tips: See also Tips for Using the Sample Maps: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zUMQK1CoSTT1FPKTAukK4M3IXS-7jAB0NgE85AnAu-g/edit?usp=sharing

compact_edition.description: All the maps are directly in the 'SIL Map Repository' folder (or the 'HK Supplementary Maps' folder, if applicable).

expanded_edition.note: This edition does not contain the FMOSoft maps.
expanded_edition.description: All the included maps are in sub-folders under the 'SIL Map Repository' folder. Those sub-folders also contain: 1) An additional copy of the English data merge source file, 2) An additional version of the IDML file that has been merged with English labels (with '@en' in filename).
expanded_edition.en_files_note: Although we strongly recommend using the data merge feature, these '@en' files are provided for users who are not up for learning how to use data merge, and who instead copy and paste labels in.

accessing_repo.title: Accessing the Map Repository
accessing_repo.full_repository_access: If you're a bonafide typesetter also needing access to the three HK maps for SIL-supported projects, please submit your request for access to the 'full repository' at tiny.cc/requestimages
accessing_repo.paratext_diagram_labeler_note: If you are using Paratext Diagram Labeler to prepare labels for Map Creator's built-in maps, the Compact editions of the repository contain our own edition of several of these maps and diagrams. Use these instead of the built-in ones, for better consistency and alignment with the Labeler terms. They are identified by the rules code 'fmo' for FMOSoft.

map_varieties.title: Understanding Map Varieties
map_varieties.subtitle: SIL Map Repository filename conventions and options

map_grouping.description: Similar maps are grouped with the same topic number, such as '185' for maps relating to Philip's travels. This is followed by a two- or three-letter code indicating the usage and attribution rules that apply, such as 'wbt'.
map_grouping.example: 185wbt - Philips Travels has three separate IDML files: base version, [sm] (shorter/square), and [sm-bw] (different short map, black & white only)

internal_options.description: Many maps have multiple options for display all within one IDML file. As you browse through the map samples, the internal options used are indicated within parentheses.
examples: 265wbt - World [1pg] (bbf riv) - Black & Blue, showing rivers

filename_components.coll_id: Collection ID. All samples from the SIL Map Repository have a collection ID of 'smr'.
filename_components.map_id: Topic number (grouping similar maps) plus 2- or 3-character code indicating the set of usage & permissions rules that apply.
filename_components.map_title: A title for the map, in English
filename_components.file_variant: Distinguishes a particular variant of the master file among other (possible) master files.
filename_components.options: Any file-internal options utilized in producing a particular sample of the map.
filename_components.lang: The language code of the language used in the map.

indesign_maps.title: Working with InDesign Maps
indesign_maps.subtitle: Complete guide for typesetting with IDML files

steps: For the map you wish to typeset, open the corresponding InDesign file (without '@en' or other language code in filename if using expanded edition)
Ensure Charis SIL and Andika fonts are installed (available in 'Document fonts' subfolder)
Toggle layers manually or use MapMonkey script for map variations (color vs black & white, etc.)
For non-Roman writing systems, modify 'font1' and 'font2' paragraph styles for proper font and rendering
If fonts lack native bold/italic, edit paragraph styles to fake faces (slight outer stroke for bold, skew for italics)
Adjust 'expanded' character style for appropriate tracking in different writing systems
For supported numeral systems, import appropriate digit style from !AllDigitStyles.indd
Save customized document as import source for future maps
create_indesign_file.font_setup_note: If seeing pink highlight behind text, check for applied Character Styles and remove them.
create_indesign_file.layers_customization: Open Layers panel (Windows/Layers) to explore customization possibilities. Toggle visibility by clicking eyeball symbol.

steps: Open repository map (.idml) and save copy in .indd format in project's \local\figures directory
Recommended naming: prefix project name (e.g., 'zezi_155wbt - Holy Land.indd') or append after @ symbol (e.g., '155wbt - Holy Land @Zezi.idml')
Go to Window > Utilities > Data Merge
From Panel Menu, choose 'Select Data Source'
Navigate to Paratext Project's \shared\labeler folder for data merge files
Enable 'Preview' mode to see labels in your language
Adjust map in preview mode: check rendering, select map options, check for overset text
Reposition text boxes as needed, adjust font sizes or paragraph styles
Hide fields containing only dashes/hyphens or 'OMIT' by un-ticking eyeball in Layers panel
Make cosmetic changes while in preview mode (do not edit preview text directly)
Save and export to jpg or pdf with Preview mode on
data_merging.overset_text: Overset text is indicated with red '+' symbol in lower right corner of text box. Use Selection tool to resize text frames.
data_merging.final_merge_note: It is NOT necessary to use the Merge button and create a second merged InDesign file initially. Do final merge after team makes no more label changes.

instructions: If Paratext project doesn't contain \fig field for this map, export map to jpg and use this to insert \fig info into Paratext
This gives two identically named files: .indd master copy with merge keys, and .jpg file in Paratext project

steps: Re-export the data merge files after team proofing
For each affected map, open master .indd file and 'Update data source' on Merge Tool menu
Save each revised map, replacing previous vernacular .indd file
When team fully approves maps with no more label changes, complete final 'Merge' step
Choose 'Create Merged Document' from Panel Menu or 'Merge Data' icon
Use default settings in dialogue box and click OK
Save new file with '-1' in name as .idml file (removes -1), preserving mergeable .indd
InDesign maps (.indd files) should be placed directly into InDesign Scripture documents
Publishing Assistant should automatically place maps with \fig markup in local/figures folder
If jpg placed instead, edit \fig markup to change filename to .indd extension
When placed directly in text, turn off title layer and include title in caption/reference of Paratext markup
Revisit all maps after final validation
Export merged map to jpg and PDF for archiving after final validation
Archive local/figures and shared/labeler folders with final publication files

map_creator_maps.title: Working with Map Creator Maps
map_creator_maps.subtitle: Complete guide for working with MAPX files

steps: Find appropriate downloaded .mapx file for the map(s) you wish to prepare
Copy file to project's \local\figures folder with naming convention: e.g., '245wbt - Seven Churches @Zezi.mapx'
Open .mapx file with Map Creator
Go to File > Import > Translation Data
Browse to .txt file exported from SIL Map & Illustration Repository
Click Finish on 'Ready to import translations'
If successful, see 'Import complete' (resolve any conflicts with previously imported translations)
Map looks same after import - go to Language dropdown under Map Options and choose your project language
Adjust location and other properties of text fields (see tutorial video: https://vimeo.com/59357958)
Fields displaying English within parentheses indicate missing translations
For labels saying 'OMIT' or containing only dashes, select and uncheck 'Visible' checkbox
Contact help@fmosoft.org for excellent support
Create PDFs and jpegs in Map Creator via File > Export
PDFs should be placed directly into InDesign Scripture documents
Publishing Assistant should automatically place maps with \fig markup in local/figures folder
If jpg placed instead, use Text Editor (ctrl-y) to edit \fig markup and change to .pdf extension
When placed directly in text, turn off title field and include in caption/reference of Paratext markup
Revisit all maps after final validation

attribution.requirement: If you use Map Creator even with maps/diagrams that did not originate from Map Creator, you are required to follow the attribution rules below, in addition to any attribution rules that may apply to the source of the maps/diagrams.
attribution.text: Publications that include material disseminated by Map Creator or produced using Map Creator must include this credit: 'Maps [and diagrams and charts] [on pages ___] are produced with Map Creator software from fmosoft.com. Used by permission. All rights reserved.'

map_monkey.title: MapMonkey
map_monkey.subtitle: Selecting options within IDML maps
map_monkey.description: MapMonkey is a tool that makes it quick and easy to 'monkey' with various map options supported by InDesign maps in the SIL Map Repository. Many maps support different map types (full color relief, black and white flat, etc.). A few maps have additional options (e.g., world locator inset can be flipped to Pacific-centric).
map_monkey.problem_solved: Manually adjusting the map for these options can require turning multiple layers on or off, and redefining paragraph styles that use blue or brown color swatches to use gray swatches instead. MapMonkey does all this through a simple dialog.
map_monkey.future_features: We anticipate enabling MapMonkey to manage switching a map between different writing system settings.

steps: Open the Scripts panel (Window > Utilities > Scripts)
Right-click on the Application folder and select 'Reveal in Explorer'
Move MapMonkey.jsx from download location into the 'Scripts Panel' folder
To run, double-click on MapMonkey.jsx in the Scripts panel

glossary.data_merge: InDesign feature that automatically populates text fields with data from external source files
glossary.IDML: InDesign Markup Language - XML-based file format readable by InDesign CS4 and later
glossary.MAPX: Map Creator's native file format for editable maps
glossary.overset_text: Text that doesn't fit within its text box, indicated by red + symbol
glossary.paragraph_styles: InDesign styles that control text formatting, font, size, and other properties
glossary.BBF: Blue & Brown, Flat - map coloring style
glossary.BBR: Blue & Brown, Relief - map coloring style with elevation shading
glossary.BWF: Black & White, Flat - monochrome map without elevation
glossary.BWR: Black & White, Relief - monochrome map with elevation shading
glossary.FCF: Full Color, Flat - full color map without elevation
glossary.FCR: Full Color, Relief - full color map with elevation shading
glossary.MCR: Muted Color, Relief - subdued color map with elevation shading
glossary.sensitive_area: Geographic region where associating publication with certain organizations could be problematic
glossary.vernacular: The local language of a translation project
glossary.typesetter: Person responsible for formatting and laying out publication for printing
glossary.attribution: Credit given to copyright holders and creators of maps/illustrations
glossary.fig_markup: Paratext markup (\fig) used to indicate where figures should be placed in text
